resources.string:
In this list you are viewing recent earthquakes ordered by magnitude in a certain area. To update the area, please select settings from the menu. Each earthquake item has a date, a location, a magnitude, and a depth. 

The date refers to the date the earthquake occurred.

The location is given in longitude and latitude and refers to the location of the epicenter of the earthquake.

The magnitude refers to the magnitude of the quake on the Richter scale. The color of the earthquake cell also relates to the magnitude of the quake (see below).

The depth refers to how far below the surface the earthquake occurred
